DataObject.abstract: The data represent 6 hourly values of selected variables for the Data Distribution Centre (DDC) of the Intergovermental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC). (see also: http://ipcc-ddc.cru.uea.ac.uk) The A1B scenario is the part of the A1 family which describes a balance across all energy sources. The experiment has been initialized in year 2000 of the 20C_1 run and continues until year 2100 with anthropogenic forcings (CO2, CH4, N2O, CFCs, O3 and sulfate) according to A1B. The experiment is extended until year 2200 with all concentrations fixed at their levels of year 2100 (stabilization experiment). Datasets with monthly average values are also available. Technical data to this experiment: The experiment is using ECHAM5.2.02a coupled to MPI-OM Vers. 1.0 GR1.5L40 and was run on a NEC-SX (hurrikan). The output from the model run: hurrikan.dkrz.de: /ut/k/k204098/EXP000/run012

title.gco:CharacterString: IPCC-AR4 MPI-ECHAM5_T63L31 MPI-OM_GR1.5L40 SRESA1B run no.1: atmosphere 6 HOUR values MPImet/MaD Germany

description.gco:CharacterString: vertical_coordinate_sytem:altitude: pressure, depth: length#horizontal_coordinate_sytem:LON and LAT: geographic

organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Max-Planck-Institut fuer Meteorologie, Model and Data Group

description.gco:CharacterString: Production System: DKRZ C3Grid Data Request Interface Implementation
